intro: [WRONG START] parablechnum wohlgemuthii, commonly known as the Wohlgemuth's parablechnum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of violet to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
